Summary:
The patient is a 71-year-old man with a likely diagnosis of microscopic polyangiitis, which is a small-vessel vasculitis. He presented with fevers, hypoxia, and pancytopenia (leukopenia and anemia). The patient's condition is unstable, and he has been transferred to the medical intensive care unit (MICU) service for ongoing care.

The patient's current plan includes evaluating the cause of his fevers, which could be due to pneumonia or other vasculitis-related etiologies. Empiric levofloxacin is being continued, and a bronchoscopy will be performed to evaluate for alveolar hemorrhage. Microbiological samples will be sent for analysis.

Regarding microscopic polyangiitis, a rheumatology consult has been called, and the patient is continuing on prednisone 60 mg daily pending further recommendations. TMP/SMX is being given for Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis, and vitamin D and calcium will be provided for bone prophylaxis. ANCA titer follow-up is also planned.

The patient's hypoxia appears to be transient and associated with fevers and rigors. A bronchoscopy will be performed, and follow-up chest X-rays are planned.

Pancytopenia, which includes leukopenia and anemia, seems to have resolved, but there may be a lab artifact given the marked change in Hgb
